intro: Cotula andreae, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Cotula andreae has narrow, linear leaves and produces numerous small florets in a composite flower head. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
